Actions like negotiations (E, F) or trade agreements (D) could alleviate tensions but are less immediate in addressing the crisis. Supply weapons to Taiwan (N) is important but should come after solidifying defensive agreements. Cybersecurity measures (J, O) and surveillance (I) are valuable but less direct. Cutting diplomatic ties (L), imposing trade restrictions (M), or executing military actions (P, Q, R, S) are extreme measures, with nuclear options (R, S) being the least reasonable in this situation.
